uk.ac.cam.cl.intelligentgamedesigner.coregame

Class GameState

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.cam.cl.intelligentgamedesigner.coregame.GameState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class GameState
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class that contains the state of a game and is responsible for making valid moves on the board and keeping track of the progress and generating the next states of the game.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public GameState(Cell[][] board,
                 GameStateProgress progress,
                 CandyGenerator candyGenerator)
        This constructor is for testing purposes
        Parameters:
        board - The board that should be copied (and is assumed to be reduced.
        progress - The current progress for the game.
        candyGenerator - The generator that will be used.

      • getRoundStatistics

        public RoundStatistics getRoundStatistics()
        Get the statistics for the round. Note: these will be valid on after the move has been completed.
        Returns:
        The round statistics for the one that just terminated.

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Function that checks whether the game has ended. Note: this can only be called if a level design was specified when constructing the game.
        Returns:

      • isGameWon

        public boolean isGameWon()
        Function that checks whether the game was won. Note: this can only be called if a level design was specified when constructing the game.

      • didFailShuffle

        public boolean didFailShuffle()

      • makeFullMove

        public void makeFullMove(Move move)
                  throws InvalidMoveException
        If the move is valid, it performs all steps until completion.
        Parameters:
        move - the move to be performed.
        Throws:
        InvalidMoveException - in case it is not a legitimate move.

      • makeInitialMove

        public void makeInitialMove(Move move)
                     throws InvalidMoveException
        Function that initiates a move, meaning that it makes the swap and transitions to the first state.
        Parameters:
        move - Move that has to be made.
        Throws:
        InvalidMoveException - in case it is not a legitimate move.

      • makeSmallMove

        public boolean makeSmallMove()
        Once the makeInitialMove has been called this takes care of making the small steps in the boards.
        Returns:
        whether there is no other step in to be made.

      • getMatchAnalysis

        public java.util.List<MatchAnalysis> getMatchAnalysis(Move move)
        Function that returns the detailed MatchAnalysis of making a move for each match that is immediately formed. Note: there are at most two such MatchAnalysis if the game state was in normal state.
        Parameters:
        move - the move to be performed.
        Returns:
        a list of the MatchAnalysis.

      • isMoveValid

        public boolean isMoveValid(Move move)
        Function that checks whether a certain move is valid.
        Parameters:
        move - the move that you want to perform
        Returns:
        whether the move is valid.

      • getValidMoves

        public java.util.List<Move> getValidMoves()
        Function that returns the valid moves in this turn. Note that the game state should be in stable mode in order to get moves that can actually be played.
        Returns:
        list of unique valid moves on the current state of the board.

      • hasMoves

        public boolean hasMoves()
        Function that returns whether there are moves on the board.
        Returns:
        whether there are any valid moves on the board.
